confirmation_bias.title: Confirmation Bias
confirmation_bias.content: The tendency to search for, interpret, favor, and recall information that confirms or supports one's prior personal beliefs or values.

anchoring_bias.title: Anchoring Bias
anchoring_bias.content: The tendency to rely too heavily on the first piece of information offered (the 'anchor') when making decisions.

availability_heuristic.title: Availability Heuristic
availability_heuristic.content: A mental shortcut that relies on immediate examples that come to a given person's mind when evaluating a specific topic, concept, method or decision.

dunning_kruger_effect.title: Dunning-Kruger Effect
dunning_kruger_effect.content: A cognitive bias in which people with low competence in a particular skill or area overestimate their ability.

belief_bias.title: Belief Bias
belief_bias.content: The tendency to judge the strength of arguments based on the plausibility of their conclusion rather than on the validity of their logical structure.

hindsight_bias.title: Hindsight Bias
hindsight_bias.content: The inclination, after an event has occurred, to see the event as having been predictable, despite there having been little or no objective basis for predicting it.

false_consensus_effect.title: False Consensus Effect
false_consensus_effect.content: The tendency for people to overestimate the extent to which their beliefs and opinions are typical of those of others.

optimism_bias.title: Optimism Bias
optimism_bias.content: A cognitive bias that causes a person to believe that they are less at risk of experiencing a negative event compared to others.

fundamental_attribution_error.title: Fundamental Attribution Error
fundamental_attribution_error.content: The tendency to explain someone's behavior based on internal factors (personality) and to underestimate the influence of external factors (situational).

halo_effect.title: Halo Effect
halo_effect.content: A cognitive bias in which an observer's overall impression of a person, company, or brand influences the observer's feelings and thoughts about that entity's character.
